[CARS-198] Setting Delay for Chain Steps
[CARS-196] Parameterization of API Input Source
Fixed Payload Issue in case of Excel Source
Fixed Payload Issue in case of Excel Source
Fixes related to API Services
[CARS-187] Create and Maintain Context per Scenario in a API Test
[CARS-188] Add Support for URL Redirection in API Calls
[CARS-189] Enable Logical/Arithmetic Expression in Expected/Precondition of Validations
[CARS-191] Setup MongoDB for Pilot Environment
Write to Appropriate NoSQL DB Based on Environment
[CARS-183] Add utility method to revalidate the API Response for a scenario on demand
[CARS-182] Ability to retrieve input values for subsequent chain steps from input source based on scenario
Changes to Support new UI for API Execution and Code Generation
Code fix for API Alert Issue
API Response Header Validation
Content-Type NULL Issue.
Changes to Support new UI for API Execution and Code Generation
Rewording of Validation Messages for better readability Added New Validation Types - Greater Than and Lesser Than
[CARS-157] Generate Payload for all input Sources - SQL, EXCEL Code Refactoring for future Enhancements
Update for Harness version 4.0
New Enhancements
Fixed Data source related issues
Build Property related changes in Harness
[CARS-105] - Fixed the warning message
[CARS-2] Centralize the definition of API URL/Endpoints from multiple sources to a normalized table.
[CARS-2] Provide ability to map APIs to specific Function and sub functions
[CARS-11]Capability to framework to run the same test case multiple times with same input
[JIRA AUTO-5253] Ability to compare API Chain Tests and report comparison results
[JIRA AUTO-5253] Ability to update the API Response(s) during the execution of comparative tests
[JIRA AUTO-5173] New Parameter Type - FORM. FORM parameter type used to send parameter in POST/PUT form request
[JIRA AUTO-5255] Ability to configure data source for expected values for validations
[JIRA AUTO-5253] Ability to get cookies from a API response and add/update cookies for next step of a chain test
[JIRA AUTO-5270] Ability to pick input sources based on the environment property configured in Jenkins
[JIRA AUTO-5267] Ability to accept all certificates
[JIRA AUTO-5287] Long Number Format Issue with latest MongoDB Driver
Display of exception stacktrace in CARS
Refactoring of HTTP Client generation for API Execution
Defect Fixes
Refractoring of Request Input Sources
MySQL End-Points mandatory for configuring API URLs
BaseUrl property removed from APITestRequest. Use serviceUrl property instead.
New production instance of Mongo DB for CARS Dash to store and report API responses
Ability to generate emailable report for all local tests. Ability to generate the emailable report in Jenkins environment based on a configuration flag
Changes to store API Response entity to MongoDB instead of storing entire HTML report in MySQL
CARS Dash changes to view HTML Report and/or Download Excel Report on the fly
CARS Dash changes to show the API Response JSON in a popup
CARS Dash changes to API Test Details Page to switch between old version and new version of API reporting
Ability to add valid custom response codes for specific API Tests (AUTO-5078)
Configuration/XML Parsing changed from DOM to JAX
Changed implementation of Connection Pooling to reduce no. of open connections
Refractoring of validation logic based on value type
Name of Package Configuration set in API Test Context changed from packageConfig to testConfig
Type of filed PayLoad in APITestResponseItem changed from String to Object to make it compatible with MongoDB format
Defect Fixes

Refactoring of URL Parameter and PayLoad data processing Refactoring of API Response processing to work consistent with JSON Object and Arrays Functionality to send both PayLoad and URL Parameters (Scenario Based) Functionality to send a list of API Requests and execute them in parallel Functionality to send Scenario Names in case of External URL Params and PayLoads Better Exception Handling. Framework will throw exceptions now in case of Configuration and Source Request processing Issues

1. New capability in comparative tests and JSON comparisons - Now users will have the capability to ignore the order of elements of Arrays when comparing JSON responses.
2. Added capability to configure failure levels in test validations (Individual Validation, Scenario or Test Case)
